rationale: No intensifier or comparative directly modifies a risk-adjective.
The segment reports action and cause factually ('will have to be killed after bird flu spread') without high-potency verbs or metaphors.
The segment describes a future action ('are to be culled'), not realised impact.
The segment reports the number of chickens/turkeys to be killed but contains no explicit calming language.
No minimiser ('only', 'just', 'merely', 'a single', 'few') combined with an explicit scale contrast.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
